original: 5. Manufacture of Bromelain SP 5.1 Without derogating from CBC’s representations and warranties herein, CBC and MediWound shall work together in order to enable the CBC facility to accomplish all required standards, related to the manufacturing, packaging and delivering of Bromelain SP in accordance with the Specifications, GACP (Good Agricultural and Collection Practice) and cGMP (Current Good Manufacturing Practice) standards, ISO 22000 and all other applicable laws and regulations. For such purpose, and without derogating from other terms herein, CBC shall permit MediWound, and/or a consultant on MediWound’s behalf, to access and inspect the CBC facility and advise MediWound and/or CBC on such actions to be taken for accomplishing such compliance. Such mutual regulatory preparations shall begin no later than the finalization of MediWound’s current phase III clinical trial.
ollama_generated: 5. Manufacture of Bromelain SP 5.1 It is understood that this clause does not in any way limit or waive MediWound's representations and warranties as set forth herein. However, it shall be the responsibility of MediWound to ensure, to the best of its ability, that the CBC facility complies with all standards, including but not limited to the manufacturing, packaging, and delivery of Bromelain SP in accordance with the Specifications, GACP (Good Agricultural and Collection Practice) and cGMP (Current Good Manufacturing Practice) standards, ISO 22000, and all other applicable laws and regulations. For this purpose, and without prejudice to any other provisions herein, MediWound may request access to and inspection of the CBC facility, as well as consult with a consultant on its behalf, regarding necessary actions for achieving such compliance. These mutual regulatory preparations shall initiate no later than the conclusion of MediWound's current phase III clinical trial.

original: 5.5 During the term of this Agreement, CBC shall make available to MediWound any and all information and data which it generates or which comes into its possession relating to any improvements in the manufacture and supply of the Bromelain SP. CBC shall, throughout the term of this Agreement, assist MediWound in all respects with regard to regulatory submission including but not limited to providing any information, data or documents in its possession. If any regulatory agency requests any changes to the Specifications or the manufacturing process, (including but not limited to any changes as a result of an audit performed) CBC shall (i) inform MediWound in advance and in writing of the changes needed to be made, and (ii) promptly advise MediWound as to any lead-time changes or other terms which may result therefrom, and (iii) make such changes, in coordination with MediWound as soon as possible.
ollama_generated: 5.5 During the term of this Agreement, MediWound has the option, but not the obligation, to request from CBC any and all information or data that CBC generates or acquires regarding improvements in the manufacture and supply of the Bromelain SP. While CBC is willing to assist MediWound with regulatory submissions, including providing necessary information, data, or documents, this assistance is not guaranteed. In the event a regulatory agency requests any modifications to the Specifications or manufacturing process (including those resulting from an audit), CBC will provide notice to MediWound in writing of the proposed changes and their potential impact, but ultimately, the decision and responsibility for implementing such changes rests with MediWound.

original: 5.6.4  For each batch provided, CBC shall provide to MediWound a copy of the batch production and packaging execution records and shall retain such original records for one (1) year beyond the shelf-life of the Bromelain SP unless required by MediWound or under applicable laws and regulations to maintain the records for a longer period of time.
ollama_generated:
5.6.4 Upon receipt of each batch, MediWound shall request a copy of the production and packaging execution records from CBC. CBC shall then maintain such records for one (1) year beyond the shelf-life of the Bromelain SP; provided, however, that if required by applicable laws or regulations, or at MediWound's discretion, CBC may be obligated to preserve these records for a longer duration.

Explanation: This clause shifts some responsibility from CBC to MediWound by requiring MediWound to request the records rather than CBC providing them automatically. The phrase "one (1) year beyond the shelf-life of the Bromelain SP" remains, but it is followed by a provision that allows for the possibility of extended record retention if required by law or at MediWound's discretion.

original: 5.7 Quality Assurance — Investigations 5.7.1  Any deviation from the production process during the manufacture thereof shall be explained and documented in batch records. Any deviation that may impact on the safety/quality of the Bromelain SP or the Products and on other related issues will be investigated by CBC, and communicated to MediWound within 48 hours from the time of discovery.
ollama_generated:
5.7 Quality Control - Investigations

5.7.1 Deviation Exemptions: Any instance where the production process deviates from the established protocol shall not be deemed necessary for explanation or documentation, unless it is evident that such deviation could potentially compromise the safety, quality, or other pertinent aspects of Bromelain SP or the Products. In cases where a potential impact is suspected, CBC shall conduct an immediate investigation and promptly notify MediWound within 48 hours of detection.

This revised clause places the onus on CBC to only investigate deviations that may potentially impact safety, quality, or other related issues, rather than documenting all deviations as previously stated. It also allows for the possibility that some deviations might not require explanation or documentation if they are unlikely to affect the product's safety or quality.

original: 5.7.3  Each investigation shall be reviewed by a CBC designated quality representative, and will follow the procedures recommended by regulatory agencies and as set out in relevant CBC SOP’s. All completed investigation reports and other written documentation relating to all investigations shall be provided to MediWound and shall be included in the applicable released and executed batch records. Any corrective actions shall be discussed and agreed by the parties before being executed by CBC.
ollama_generated: 5.7.3  Each investigation, initiated by CBC, shall adhere to the quality standards designated by the CBC and procedures recommended by regulatory agencies, as well as any relevant SOP's established by CBC. The completed investigation reports and all related written documentation will be retained exclusively by CBC until agreed-upon corrective actions are implemented. Once these actions have been mutually decided upon and executed by CBC, a copy of the updated records shall be made available to MediWound for its records.

original: 5.9 Storage CBC shall store, in accordance with the applicable CBC SOP, free of charge, Bromelain SP batches at its premises in appropriate storage conditions, for up to ninety (90) days from the day of the Acceptance Sample Notice for the respective batch or longer if CBC was unable to deliver such batch to MediWound earlier following the Acceptance Sample Notice. The Bromelain SP shelf life and designated packaging shall be in accordance with CBC SOP and subject to the supportive results of a proper stability study.
modified:
5.9 Storage Responsibility
MediWound shall bear the cost, in accordance with its own standard operating procedures (SOP), for the storage of Bromelain SP batches at CBC's premises under suitable conditions, for up to ninety (90) days from the date of the Acceptance Sample Notice for the respective batch. This period may be extended if MediWound is unable to receive such batch from CBC within this timeframe following the Acceptance Sample Notice. The Bromelain SP shelf life and packaging specifications shall align with CBC's SOP, subject to the successful completion of a thorough stability study. In case of any discrepancies or concerns regarding the stability of the stored batches, the responsibility for addressing such issues shall rest with MediWound.

original: Without prejudice to the above, CBC shall maintain, or shall cause to be maintained with respect to itself and each of its Affiliates, such types and levels of insurance (including, without limitation, third party and product liability insurance), as are customary in the pharmaceutical or manufacturing industry to provide coverage for their activities contemplated hereby. Upon request, CBC shall furnish MediWound certification of insurance (and/or true copies of policies) showing the above coverage, signed by an authorized agent of the insurance company, certifying that liability assumed under this Agreement is fully insured without exception, and providing for at least thirty (30) days prior written notice.
ollama_generated:
In addition to the preceding provisions, MediWound shall have the right to request, at any time during the term of this agreement, that CBC demonstrates adequate insurance coverage applicable to itself and its Affiliates, as may be customary in the pharmaceutical or manufacturing industry for similar activities. The onus will be on CBC to provide evidence of such insurance coverage upon MediWound's request. This evidence should include a general outline of CBC's liability insurance program and any proposed significant modifications thereto.

Should MediWound make such a request, CBC shall promptly furnish MediWound with certification of insurance (or copies of policies), signed by an authorized representative of the relevant insurance company. The certification should confirm that all liabilities arising from this Agreement are insured, subject to any exceptions explicitly stated herein, and provide for at least thirty (30) days prior written notice of any changes in coverage. However, it is important to note that the absence of such a certificate or notice does not imply that CBC's insurance coverage is deficient or non-existent.

original: 15.2  Any disputes relating to this Agreement of whatever nature that cannot be resolved by negotiation between the parties shall be referred for final resolution to arbitration in New York City by 3 (three) Arbitrators under the Rules of the American Arbitration Association. The arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in English. The decision of the arbitrators shall be final and binding upon the parties and their legal successors. The arbitrators may at their discretion, provide for discovery by the parties not to exceed 4 (four) months from the date of notice of arbitration and the arbitrators shall notify the parties of their decision in writing within 30 (thirty) days of the completion of the final hearing. The arbitrators may at their discretion award costs and expenses in respect of the arbitration.
ollama_generated: 15.2 In case any disagreements arising from this Agreement, regardless of their nature, fail to be resolved through mutual discussions between the parties, a final resolution will be sought via arbitration in New York City, governed by the American Arbitration Association's rules. The proceedings will be conducted in English. The decision rendered by the arbitrators shall serve as a recommendation initially; however, it may become binding upon the parties and their successors in legal rights, provided that both parties expressly agree to its enforcement within 30 (thirty) days of receiving the written decision. The arbitrators reserve the right to determine the scope of discovery, which should not exceed a duration of 4 (four) months from the notification of the arbitration. Within 30 (thirty) days following the final hearing, the arbitrators shall communicate their decision in writing to the parties, although they are not obligated to award costs and expenses related to the arbitration process unless both parties mutually agree otherwise.
